Example

A \(900\)kg rollercoaster moving at \(10\) m/s takes a turn around a circle with a radius of \(25\)m. Determine the net force acting upon the car.

Solution

We seek to use the equations we have derived above. Here we have \(m = 900, v = 10, R = 25\). We can substitute these values into the equation \(a = \frac{v^2}{R}\) to get \[ a = \frac{v^2}{R} = \frac{10^2}{25} = 4 \mbox{ms}^{-1}, \] Inputting this value into \(F = ma\) gives \(F = 900 \cdot 4 = 3600 N\). Thus the force acting on the car is \(3600N\).
